tasks.title: Project Setup and Next.js 14+ App Router Configuration

tasks.title: Supabase Integration and Database Schema Setup
tasks.description: Set up Supabase project, configure authentication, create database tables, and implement Row Level Security policies
tasks.details: Create Supabase project and install @supabase/supabase-js. Set up environment variables for SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_ANON_KEY. Create database tables: profiles (id, full_name, credits), resumes (id, user_id, file_url, raw_text, title, created_at), analyses (id, resume_id, job_description_text, match_score, missing_keywords JSONB, suggestions JSONB). Implement RLS policies: users can only access their own profiles, resumes, and analyses. Configure Supabase Storage bucket for resume uploads with appropriate security policies.
tasks.testStrategy: Test database connection from Next.js app. Verify RLS policies by attempting to access data from different user contexts. Test Supabase Storage upload functionality. Ensure all foreign key relationships work correctly.

subtasks.title: Initialize Supabase project and connect it to the Next.js app
subtasks.description: Create a new Supabase project in the dashboard and connect it to the existing Next.js 14 app using the Supabase JavaScript client.
subtasks.details:
Create a new Supabase project in the Supabase dashboard, note the project URL and anon/public key, install @supabase/supabase-js in the Next.js project, and create a reusable Supabase client (e.g., in lib/supabaseClient.ts) using createClient with the project URL and anon key. Ensure the client is imported only in appropriate runtime contexts (browser vs server) following Supabase Next.js guidance.

subtasks.title: Create database tables and relationships for profiles, resumes, and analyses
subtasks.description: Define and apply SQL schema for profiles, resumes, and analyses tables with appropriate columns, types, and foreign keys.
subtasks.details:
In Supabase SQL editor or via migrations, create tables: profiles(id uuid primary key references auth.users(id) on delete cascade, full_name text, credits integer default 0), resumes(id uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(), user_id uuid references auth.users(id) on delete cascade, file_url text, raw_text text, title text, created_at timestamptz default now()), analyses(id uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(), resume_id uuid references resumes(id) on delete cascade, job_description_text text, match_score integer, missing_keywords jsonb, suggestions jsonb, created_at timestamptz default now()). Add useful indexes (e.g., on resumes.user_id and analyses.resume_id).

subtasks.title: Implement Supabase Row Level Security policies for user-scoped data
subtasks.description: Enable RLS and create policies so users can only access their own profiles, resumes, and analyses.
subtasks.details:
Enable RLS on profiles, resumes, and analyses tables. Add policies such as: for profiles, using auth.uid() = id; for resumes, using auth.uid() = user_id; for analyses, using auth.uid() = (select user_id from resumes where resumes.id = analyses.resume_id). Create separate policies for SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE as needed to match the app’s behavior. Ensure auth schema and JWT configuration are correctly set so auth.uid() is available.

Test error handling for API failures and malformed responses. Validate match score calculation consistency. Test with various resume and job description combinations to ensure reliable analysis.
